oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Overextended, between 1950 and 1956
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original political cartoon created by Jack Knox, the Nashville Banner editorial cartoonist from the mid-1940s to the early 1970s. This caricature depicts a worried President Gamal Nasser of Egypt straddling two sides of the Suez Canal while holding a sign that says "Egyptian Seizure." For several years, circa the 1950s, there was a practice of interference with commercial shipping bound to or from Israel. Nasser nationalized the Suez Canal in July 1956, which caused immediate concern internationally in regards to maritime traffic in the Canal. Forms part of the Jack Knox Political Cartoon Collection. 1 original cartoon drawing : b & w ; 14.25 x 19.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nasser, Gamal Abdel, 1918-1970--Caricatures and cartoons
